p: Infection assays were carried out three times for host penetration assays, and leaf segments were excised from 8-day-old seedlings of barley ( Hordeum vulgare cv ZJ-8). Drops (20 μL) of conidial suspension (5 × 10 4 conidia/mL) were deposited onto the upper surface of the excised leaves in a dew chamber at 25°C. The leaves were examined for disease lesions at 24, 48, 72, and 96 h after inoculation after decoloration by methanol and preservation in lactophenol, as described previously [ 40].
